src:
Stiv Ker izveo najslabiju petorku u istoriji NBA? Korkmaz utišao Portland u poslednjoj sekundi (VIDEO)
Javnost glasno priča o situaciji u kojoj se Voriorsi nalaze, Marko Gudurić solidan, Adetokunbo srušio šampiona, Irving ne može sam

03 Nov 2019


Golden Stejt, 2. novembar 2018. godine. Utakmicu protiv Minesote počinju Stef Kari, Klej Tompson, Drejmond Grin, Kevin Durant i Demijan Džons.


Golden Stejt, 2. novembar 2018. godine. Utakmicu protiv Šarlota počinju Džordan Puli, Erik Paskal, Kaj Boumen, Glen Robinson III i Vili Koli Stajn.

Put koji su Voriorsi, donedavno najdominantnija sila svetske košarke, prošli u poslednjih godinu dana potpuno je neverovatan... Da, svima je jasno da je Kevin Durant napustio franšizu, da Klej Tompson neće igrati verovatno cele sezone zbog teške povrede prednjih ukrštenih ligamenata, da će Stef Kari biti odsutan do februara, a da Drejmond Grin zbog povrede prsta nije mogao da odgovori izazovu. Kada na to dodate da je i D’Anđelo Rasel iskrenuo skočni zglob, nije ni čudo što je američka sportska javnost otišla toliko daleko da je petorku koju je Stiv Ker spremio za meč protiv Šarlota dobila etiketu “najslabija u istoriji NBA lige”. Tačnije, novinari s one strane okeana izazivali su svoje pratioce na društvenim mrežama da navedu koja je to lošija petorka viđena otkako je NBA liga organizovana?


Jokićeva briljantnost za slom Orlanda - iz okreta, s jedne noge, preko Vučevića s velikim lukom (VIDEO)


Šarlot se lepšo počastio u novom domu Voriorsa i slavio rezultatom 93:87, a pobedi su najviše doprineli Dvejn Bejkon s 25 i Teri Rozir s 20 poena. Velika je šteta što i pored svih muka s povredama nije bilo mesta za Alena Smailagića, ali valjda će biser srpske košarke dobiti svoj prostor u nastavku sezone. U odsustvu apsolutno svih najvećih zvezda Golden Stejta najefikasniji bio je Erik Paskal s 25 poena (10/18 iz igre, 0/5 za tri), dok su Kaj Boumen i Glen Robinson III ubacili po 16 poena.
Kako je krenulo, čini se da su Voriorsi uveliko ušli u fazu ozbiljnog posrtanja...



Dok Golden Stejt pada, Filadelfija raste! A, posle dramatične završnice u Moda Centru i pobede nad Portlandom s tesnih 109:108, samopouzdanje Seventisiksersa skočilo je do svodova velelepne dvorane u srcu Oregona. 
Kakav je to samo finiš susreta bio. Prvo je Anferni Simons pogodio trojku iz ćoška na asistenciju Demijana Lilarda, dok je na semaforu ostalo svega još 2,2 sekunde do kraja, da bi onda istom merom uzvratio Furkan Korkmaz i to pošto je dobio fantastičnu blokadu od Ala Horforda kako bi pobegao najboljem igraču Trejlblejzersa i s lakoćom zapečatio pobedu! Domaćinu je ostalo svega 0,4 sekunde za realizaciju, što nije bilo dovoljno da se u ovom slučaju uradi nešto konkretno.



Korkmazje meč završio s 11 poena, a efikasniji od njega bili su Ben Simons s 18 poena i 11 skokova, uz osam asistencija, te Džoš Ričardson s 17, Horford s 25 i Tobijas Heris s 23 poena. Kod Portlanda Lilard je imao 33 poena (11/16 iz igre, 8/11 za tri), Rodni Hud je ubacio 25, a Si Džej Mekolum tek 16 poena.



Memfis Marka Gudurića morao je da položi oružje na svom terenu, pošto je Finiks bio bolji rezultatom 114:105. Srpski reprezentativac je odigrao malo više od 12 minuta, a meč je završio s po dva poena (1/3 iz igre) i asistencije, uz osam uhvaćenih lopti. Prvi strelac Grizlija bio je Dilon Bruks s 16 poena, dok je najbolji kod Sansa bio Devin Buker s 21 poenom.



Milvoki je na krilima Janisa Adetokunba presudio aktuelnom šampionu Torontu i slavio rezultatom 115:105. Prošlosezonski MVP ubeležio je 36 poena, 15 skokova i osam asistencija za 36 minuta u igri, dok je kod Reptorsa Kajl Lauri imao isti košgeterski učinak.




NBA – rezultati

Detroit – Bruklin 113:109/Dramond 25 – Irving 20/
Orlando – Denver 87:91/Vučević 24 – Denver 20/
Memfis – Finiks 105:114/Morant 24 – Buker 21/
Milvoki – Toronto 115:105/Adetokunbo 36 – Lauri 36/
Vašington – Minesota 109:131/Bil 30 – Vigins 21/
Golden Stejt – Šarlot 87:93/Paskal 25 – Bejkon 25/
Portland – Filadelfija 128:129/Lilard 33 – Horford 25/

ISTOČNA KONFERENCIJA





ZAPADNA KONFERENCIJA




Foto: Reuters
text:
Steve Kerr performed the worst five in NBA history? Corkmaz silenced Portland at the last second (VIDEO)
The public is talking loudly about the situation in which the Warriors are, Marko Guduric solid, Adetokunbo knocks down champion, Irving cannot alone

03 Nov 2019


Golden State, November 2, 2018. The match against Minnesota starts with Steph Curry, Clay Thompson, Draymond Greene, Kevin Durant and Demian Jones.


Golden State, November 2, 2018. The match against Charlotte starts with Jordan Poole, Eric Pascal, Kay Boumen, Glen Robinson III and Willie Colly Stein.

The path that the Warriors, until recently the most dominant force in world basketball, have undergone in the last year is absolutely unbelievable ... Yes, it's clear to everyone that Kevin Durant has left the franchise, that Clay Thompson is unlikely to play all season because of a severe frontal ligament injury, yes Steph Curry will be absent until February without Draymond Green unable to respond to the challenge due to a finger injury. When you add that D'Angelo Russell twisted his ankle, it's no wonder that the American sports public went so far as to get the label "worst in NBA history" by Steve Kerr to prepare for the match against Charlotte. More specifically, reporters from across the ocean have been challenging their followers on social media to name which one of the worse fives has been seen since the NBA was organized?


Jokic's brilliance for the Orlando breakdown - from a turn, with one leg, over Vucevic with a big bow (VIDEO)


Charlotte did a nicer job in the Warriors' new home and celebrated 93-87 with Dane Bacon 25 and Terry Rosier 20 points most. It is a great pity that despite all his injuries, there was no room for Alen Smailagic, but it is likely that the pearl of Serbian basketball will get its space as the season progresses. In the absence of absolutely all the biggest Golden State stars, Eric Pascal was most effective with 25 points (10/18 from the game, 0/5 for three), while Kaj Boumen and Glen Robinson III each scored 16 points.
As it started, the Warriors seem to have entered a serious stumbling block ...



As Golden State falls, Philadelphia grows! And, after a dramatic finish at the Moda Center and a win over Portland with a tight 109: 108, the Seventisiksers' confidence skyrocketed to the vaults of a magnificent hall in the heart of Oregon.
What a finale of the meeting it was. First, Anferni Simmons hit a three-pointer from the corner to assist Demian Lillard, with only 2.2 seconds left in the scoreboard, then Furkan Corkmaz reciprocating in the same measure after receiving a fantastic block from Al Horford to escape the best player Trailblazers seal the win with ease! The host was left with only 0.4 seconds to complete, which was not enough to do anything concrete in this case.



Korkmazje finished the match with 11 points and more efficient than him were Ben Simons with 18 points and 11 rebounds, with eight assists, and Josh Richardson with 17, Horford with 25 and Tobias Heris with 23 points. At Portland, Lillard had 33 points (11/16 from the game, 8/11 for three), Rodney Hood scored 25, and JJ McAllum only 16 points.



Mark Guduric's Memphis had to lay down their weapons on their field, as Phoenix was better with 114: 105. The Serbian national team played just over 12 minutes and the match ended with two points each (1/3 from the game) and assists, with eight catches. The Grizzlies' first scorer was Dillon Brooks with 16 points, while Sansa's best was Devin Booker with 21 points.



Milwaukee surpassed current champion Toronto on Janis Adetokunba's wings and celebrated 115: 105. Last season's MVP recorded 36 points, 15 rebounds and eight assists in 36 minutes of play, while with the Reptors, Kyle Lauri had the same basket-ball effect.




NBA - Results

Detroit - Brooklyn 113: 109 / Drummond 25 - Irving 20 /
Orlando - Denver 87: 91 / Vucevic 24 - Denver 20 /
Memphis - Phoenix 105: 114 / Morant 24 - Booker 21 /
Milwaukee - Toronto 115: 105 / Adetokunbo 36 - Lauri 36 /
Washington - Minnesota 109: 131 / Bill 30 - Wiggins 21 /
Golden State - Charlotte 87: 93 / Pascal 25 - Bacon 25 /
Portland - Philadelphia 128: 129 / Lillard 33 - Horford 25 /
